question.text: In angiosperms, female gametophyte is embryo sac which is formed by

options.text: Reduction division followed by equational division in megaspore mother cell

Both  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text: The megaspore mother cell undergoes, reductional division to form four megaspore, three of which degenerates, one functional megaspore undergoes mitosis to form embryo sac or female gametophyte. The functional megaspore undergoes, three mitosis to form seven celled, eight nucleate embryosac.
